definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: Adorning the Jin Dashan of milistary exploit chapter is demobilized from army before the bosom, returned home town.
sentences.chinese: 胸前佩戴着军功章的金大山从部队复员，回到了家乡。

sentences.english: Home visits when the meet again tears demobilization yes, yes right mother's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 探家复员时重逢的泪水是，是对母亲的思念。

sentences.english: The demobilized soldiers were reformed into unofficial semi-military organizations.
sentences.chinese: 复员军人被改编组成非正式的半军事化组织。

sentences.english: Today, the housing scheme is open to all disabled, demobilized soldiers, regardless of previous military affiliation.
sentences.chinese: 如今，住房工程面向各武装小组的所有残疾复员战员。

sentences.english: As this progressive withdrawal takes place, a number of units shall demobilize .
sentences.chinese: 随着部队的不断撤离，一些部队单位将复员。

sentences.english: Thierry Henry will be rested and Robin van Persie may be back after a knee problem.
sentences.chinese: 亨利将会休息，范佩尔西也许会在膝伤复员后出场。

sentences.english: Then I shall be demobilised and I'll marry you.
sentences.chinese: 然后我就复员，和你结婚。

sentences.english: He was a cook before his demobilization.
sentences.chinese: 他复员以前是一名炊事员。

definition: to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
to be discharged from military service
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to rise through the ranks (as a party cadre)
to retire/to leave work and rest (euphemism for compulsory retirement of old cadres)
to enlist/to serve in the army
